title: libc and test features are special-cased for feature validity checks

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.

body:
When implementing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/52644, where we emit errors when using unknown features, I had to special case two features: `libc` and `test`, because they weren't being picked up (and there were time constraints).

The special-casing is here:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/0aa8d0320266b5579428312095fe49af05ada972/src/librustc/middle/stability.rs#L840-L847
- `libc` is declared unlike any other feature:
https://github.com/rust-lang/libc/blob/6bdbf5dc937459bd10e6bc4dc52b0adbd8cf4358/src/lib.rs#L92-L94
so it's not entirely surprising that the detection overlooks it, but I didn't find the root cause.
- I didn't manage to figure out what makes `test` special.

Ideally these should both not be special-cased. The relevant code for feature collection is in `src/librustc/middle/lib_features.rs`, so that's a good place to start looking.
